title: Definitions
context: [ยง346-142] Definitions. As used in this part: &ldquo;Alien&rdquo; means any person not a citizen or national of the United States but who is allowed, under federal law, to reside in the United States. &ldquo;Homeland&rdquo; means the country in which a person was born. &ldquo;Naturalized citizen&rdquo; means a person who was not born in the United States, but who has the rights and privileges of a citizen bestowed upon the person by law. &ldquo;Qualified person&rdquo; means an alien or naturalized citizen of the United States who: (1) Is a resident of the State of Hawaii; (2) Is sixty years of age or older; (3) Is eligible to receive or receives financial assistance under this chapter on the date of the application for transportation assistance under this part. &ldquo;Transportation assistance&rdquo; means the amount determined by the director under section 346-145. [L 1980, c 276, pt of ยง2] Revision Note Pursuant to ยง23G-15: (1) Numeric designations deleted and punctuation changed; and (2) In the definition of &ldquo;qualified person&rdquo;, paragraphs redesignated and in paragraph (3), &ldquo;and&rdquo; deleted.
